revised_title: A New Integrating Photometer for X-Ray Crystal Reflections
tldr: The authors developed a new integrating photometer for measuring the total intensity of X-ray crystal reflections. The photometer uses a carbon print of an X-ray image instead of the negative itself, and beta particles instead of light. This innovative method allows for accurate measurements of integrated intensities in X-ray crystallography, providing valuable insights into the structure and properties of materials.
